message: I have a four Models, A, B, C, D where B is a Many-to-Many table between A and C, and D is many to one against C
Anyone have any idea on how given an instance of A, I can count the number of unique D's?
SQL would be something like select count(distinct *) from A join B on (B.a_id = a.id) join C on (B.c_id = C.id) join D on (D.c_id = C.id) where A.id = ?
though I can't remember if that's the proper count distinct syntax
@alex Nifty voodoo, I had an extra table so it ended up as: TargetHomolog.objects.filter(target__drugtarget__drug=d).distinct().count()
I don't even want to know what a Homolog is.
@justinlilly Then whatever you do, don't follow this link: http://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/homolog
